item.title: M add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: M add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: M add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: M add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: M add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Now I know the things I know, and I do the things I do; and if you do not like me so, to hell, my love, with you!" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: M add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Men seldom make passes at girls who wear glasses." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: M add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"<i>Inventory:</i>
"Four be the things I am wiser to know: Idleness, sorrow, a friend, and a foe. Four be the things I'd been better without: Love, curiosity, freckles, and doubt. Three be the things I shall never attain: Envy, content, and sufficient champagne. Three be the things I shall have till I die: Laughter and hope and a sock in the eye." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: M add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Never, never, never give in!" -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: M add a quote by Joan of Arc
item.description: "I am not afraid... I was born to do this." -- Joan of Arc

item.title: M add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: M add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "I love the friends I have gathered together on this thin raft..." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: M add a quote by E. B. White
item.description: "You have been my friend. That in itself is a tremendous thing. I wove my webs for you because I liked you. After all, what's a life, anyway? We're born, we live a little while, we die. A spider's life can't help being something of a mess, with all this trapping and eating flies. By helping you, perhaps I was trying to lift up my life a trifle. Heaven knows anyone's life can stand a little of that." -- E. B. White

item.title: M add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: M add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: M add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Why do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: M add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"In youth, it was a way I had, To do my best to please. And change, with every passing lad To suit his theories.
But now I know the things I know And do the things I do, And if you do not like me so, To hell, my love, with you." -- Dorothy Parker
